summary: This document is an email chain forwarded to the FBI by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The chain includes a message from a victim (and their mother) identifying themselves as victims of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and their associates, and requesting information about the cases, prosecution, and victim resources.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Forwards a victim's email to the FBI for follow-up. Works at the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Wendy Olsen
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Wendy Olsen (USANYS)) in the email chain.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a perpetrator.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a perpetrator.

connections.description: Both are named together by a victim as perpetrators.
A victim identifies both as perpetrators against them and their mother.

events.title: Victim Email to US Attorney's Office
events.description: A victim (and their mother) sends an email to the US Attorney's Office identifying themselves as victims of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and their associates, and requests information about the cases, prosecution, and resources.

events.title: Email Forwarded to FBI
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney forwards the victim's email to the FBI for follow-up.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A victim and their mother identify themselves as victims of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and their associates.
The victim's email is forwarded by an Assistant United States Attorney to the FBI for follow-up, indicating ongoing investigative interest.
The communication demonstrates victims were actively reaching out to authorities in July 2020 regarding the Epstein/Maxwell cases.
The email is sent via ProtonMail Secure Email, suggesting a concern for privacy or security by the victim.
